title: Live Updates: Outrage at Netanyahu Grows Over Hostage Deaths
content: Thousands of Israeli workers walked off the job in anger over the deaths of hostages in Gaza. President Biden said Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu was not doing enough to bring the hostages home.
summary: Thousands of Israeli workers walked off the job in anger over the deaths of hostages in Gaza. President Biden said Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu was not doing enough to bring the hostages home.

title: Hamas Documents Reveal Tunnel Battle Strategy
content: Hamas leaders spent years developing an underground warfare plan. Records from the battlefield show the group’s preparations, including blast doors to protect against Israeli bombs and soldiers.
summary: Hamas leaders spent years developing an underground warfare plan. Records from the battlefield show the group’s preparations, including blast doors to protect against Israeli bombs and soldiers.

title: In a Kyiv Classroom, Cries for Help From Children Scarred by War
content: “They are like a bleeding wound, and no one sees it,” a schoolteacher said of her pupils, many of whom have fled frontline areas or lost family members in the fighting.
summary: “They are like a bleeding wound, and no one sees it,” a schoolteacher said of her pupils, many of whom have fled frontline areas or lost family members in the fighting.

title: Russia Hits Ukraine With Wave of Strikes as School Year Opens
content: The attack, the third large-scale bombardment in a week, coincided with intense fighting in eastern Ukraine and Russia.
summary: The attack, the third large-scale bombardment in a week, coincided with intense fighting in eastern Ukraine and Russia.

title: Takeaways From East Germany’s State Elections
content: The far-right Alternative for Germany, or AfD, had a very successful night in two states, despite its state chapters’ classification as “extremist” by German domestic intelligence.
summary: The far-right Alternative for Germany, or AfD, had a very successful night in two states, despite its state chapters’ classification as “extremist” by German domestic intelligence.

title: Pope Francis Begins Grueling Asia Tour
content: The 11-day trip, a signal that Francis does not intend to slow down, requires nearly 45 hours of air travel and meetings in tropical climates.
summary: The 11-day trip, a signal that Francis does not intend to slow down, requires nearly 45 hours of air travel and meetings in tropical climates.

title: Helicopter Crash That Killed Iran’s President Was Caused by Bad Weather, Report Says
content: Thick fog was a factor in the May crash that killed President Ebrahim Raisi, an armed forces investigation found. His death shook Iran at a strained moment for the country.
summary: Thick fog was a factor in the May crash that killed President Ebrahim Raisi, an armed forces investigation found. His death shook Iran at a strained moment for the country.

title: France Confronts Horror of Rape and Drugging Case as 51 Men Go on Trial
content: A man is accused of drugging his wife and then inviting dozens of men to rape her over almost a decade. The questions raised by the case have unsettled the country.
summary: A man is accused of drugging his wife and then inviting dozens of men to rape her over almost a decade. The questions raised by the case have unsettled the country.

title: The Quiet Collaboration Between Paralympic Athletes and Their Assistants
content: For competition partners who share the mutual goal of winning medals, eye contact or a simple touch can be all the communication that’s needed.
summary: For competition partners who share the mutual goal of winning medals, eye contact or a simple touch can be all the communication that’s needed.

title: Record Rainfall Spoils Crops in China, Rattling Leaders
content: Some vegetables cost more than they have in five years. Top Chinese officials have made a point of showing that they’re doing something about it.
summary: Some vegetables cost more than they have in five years. Top Chinese officials have made a point of showing that they’re doing something about it.

title: Elon Musk’s Starlink Defies Brazil Court Order to Block X
content: The satellite internet service controlled by Elon Musk is refusing to comply with a court order to block his social network, X, regulators said.
summary: The satellite internet service controlled by Elon Musk is refusing to comply with a court order to block his social network, X, regulators said.

title: What It’s Like in Egypt as Energy Crisis Prompts Early Shop Closures
content: It’s so hot in Cairo that people like to go out all night. It might look like a party, but in reality, one shopkeeper said, “everybody is dead on the inside.”
summary: It’s so hot in Cairo that people like to go out all night. It might look like a party, but in reality, one shopkeeper said, “everybody is dead on the inside.”

title: The Venezuelan City Devastated By Migration
content: About a quarter of the residents of Maracaibo, Venezuela’s second-largest city, have moved away — and more are expected to soon follow.
summary: About a quarter of the residents of Maracaibo, Venezuela’s second-largest city, have moved away — and more are expected to soon follow.

title: India’s Doctors Are Overworked and Feeling Unsafe
content: Grueling shifts, abuse from the public and subpar security are nothing new to medical workers in India, where a ghastly killing has put a spotlight on their plight.
summary: Grueling shifts, abuse from the public and subpar security are nothing new to medical workers in India, where a ghastly killing has put a spotlight on their plight.

title: UK Suspends Some Arms Sales to Israel
content: Britain’s foreign secretary, David Lammy, said there was a “clear risk” some weapons might be used to commit “a serious violation of international humanitarian law.”
summary: Britain’s foreign secretary, David Lammy, said there was a “clear risk” some weapons might be used to commit “a serious violation of international humanitarian law.”

title: Biden Says Netanyahu Is Not Doing Enough to Free Israeli Hostages
content: The president told reporters he would have more to say after a meeting later Monday in the White House Situation Room.
summary: The president told reporters he would have more to say after a meeting later Monday in the White House Situation Room.

title: Gao Zhen, Artist Who Critiqued the Cultural Revolution, Is Detained in China
content: Mr. Gao is being held on suspicion of slandering China’s heroes and martyrs, an offense punishable by up to three years in prison, his brother said.
summary: Mr. Gao is being held on suspicion of slandering China’s heroes and martyrs, an offense punishable by up to three years in prison, his brother said.

title: Histadrut, the Labor Union Behind Israel’s Strike, Has Long History of Influence
content: The union, which predates Israel’s founding, led a strike last year that helped force Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to suspend a plan to overhaul the judiciary.
summary: The union, which predates Israel’s founding, led a strike last year that helped force Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to suspend a plan to overhaul the judiciary.

title: The Four Mysterious Guardians of the Artist Lee Bul
content: This fall the Metropolitan Museum of Art’s facade will feature strange, humanoid sculptures. If they induce a feeling of nausea, that’s what Lee was going for.
summary: This fall the Metropolitan Museum of Art’s facade will feature strange, humanoid sculptures. If they induce a feeling of nausea, that’s what Lee was going for.

title: Monday Briefing
content: Anger and grief in Israel.

content: The Israeli military said Sunday that Hamas had killed the hostages before they were discovered by Israeli troops on Saturday.
summary: The Israeli military said Sunday that Hamas had killed the hostages before they were discovered by Israeli troops on Saturday.

title: Israeli Protesters Demand a Deal for the Release of Hostages
content: Demonstrations spread across cities around the country after the Israeli military said it had recovered the bodies of six hostages killed in Gaza.
summary: Demonstrations spread across cities around the country after the Israeli military said it had recovered the bodies of six hostages killed in Gaza.

title: Simon Verity, World-Renowned Stone Carver, Is Dead at 79
content: He headed the team that created the statues of biblical figures at the Cathedral of St. John the Divine in Manhattan.
summary: He headed the team that created the statues of biblical figures at the Cathedral of St. John the Divine in Manhattan.

title: East Germans Lean Toward Extremes in State Elections
content: The Alternative for Germany party was on course to win in Thuringia, according to projections, in what was seen as a worrying sign of the health of German democracy.
summary: The Alternative for Germany party was on course to win in Thuringia, according to projections, in what was seen as a worrying sign of the health of German democracy.

title: Helicopter Crash Near Volcano in Russia’s Far East Kills at Least 17
content: The helicopter was flying tourists in Russia’s Kamchatka region. No survivors were expected among the 22 people on board, state news agencies said.
summary: The helicopter was flying tourists in Russia’s Kamchatka region. No survivors were expected among the 22 people on board, state news agencies said.

title: Three Israeli Police Officers Killed in the West Bank
content: The officers were shot and killed in what the Israeli police said was a terrorist attack. The incident followed a rise in Palestinian and Israeli violence, as Israel’s military raids Palestinian cities.
summary: The officers were shot and killed in what the Israeli police said was a terrorist attack. The incident followed a rise in Palestinian and Israeli violence, as Israel’s military raids Palestinian cities.

content: One of the hostages, Hersh Goldberg-Polin, was an American citizen.

title: Russians Bomb Kharkiv, Ukraine Says, After Russia Reports Wave of Attacks
content: Ukraine said Russia struck the country’s second-largest city with missiles and bombs. Russian state media and local officials earlier reported that Ukraine attacked power plants and refineries with drones.
summary: Ukraine said Russia struck the country’s second-largest city with missiles and bombs. Russian state media and local officials earlier reported that Ukraine attacked power plants and refineries with drones.

title: China and the Philippines Collide Again in the South China Sea
content: The United States condemned the episode near Sabina Shoal in the South China Sea and reaffirmed its defense treaty with Manila.
summary: The United States condemned the episode near Sabina Shoal in the South China Sea and reaffirmed its defense treaty with Manila.

title: With Russia on Its Doorstep, a Ukrainian Town Packs Its Bags
content: Ukraine gambled that its move into Russia would draw Moscow’s forces away from the town of Pokrovsk. It didn’t happen. And now resigned residents are evacuating daily.
summary: Ukraine gambled that its move into Russia would draw Moscow’s forces away from the town of Pokrovsk. It didn’t happen. And now resigned residents are evacuating daily.

title: Dragons and Sharks on a Beach Near You: The Story of the Great Lego Spill
content: Nearly five million Lego pieces plunged into the sea in 1997. The pieces are still showing up — on England’s coast, in Ireland, Belgium, France and possibly at the beach near you.
summary: Nearly five million Lego pieces plunged into the sea in 1997. The pieces are still showing up — on England’s coast, in Ireland, Belgium, France and possibly at the beach near you.

content: Israel and Hamas agreed to pause the war to permit the vaccination of 640,000 children in Gaza, a daunting effort for health workers.
summary: Israel and Hamas agreed to pause the war to permit the vaccination of 640,000 children in Gaza, a daunting effort for health workers.

title: What to Watch For in East German State Elections on Sunday
content: The prospect of a strong performance by the far-right Alternative for Germany party in two state elections is only one of the problems for Chancellor Olaf Scholz.
summary: The prospect of a strong performance by the far-right Alternative for Germany party in two state elections is only one of the problems for Chancellor Olaf Scholz.

title: Israel Says It Has Recovered More Bodies in Gaza
content: The Israeli military asked the public not to speculate, but many Israelis assumed the announcement referred to dead hostages. The news amplified calls for a cease-fire and hostage-release deal.
summary: The Israeli military asked the public not to speculate, but many Israelis assumed the announcement referred to dead hostages. The news amplified calls for a cease-fire and hostage-release deal.

title: Eiffel Tower Will Keep Olympic Rings Permanently, Mayor Says
content: “I want the two to remain married,” Mayor Anne Hidalgo of Paris said in a newspaper interview.
summary: “I want the two to remain married,” Mayor Anne Hidalgo of Paris said in a newspaper interview.

title: Hvaldimir the ‘Spy’ Whale Is Found Dead in Norwegian Waters
content: The beluga whale, who was first spotted in 2019 wearing what looked like a camera harness, was seen floating in Norwegian waters on Saturday.
summary: The beluga whale, who was first spotted in 2019 wearing what looked like a camera harness, was seen floating in Norwegian waters on Saturday.

title: Why Brazil Banned X
content: To combat disinformation, Brazil gave one judge broad power to police the internet. Now, after he blocked X, some are wondering whether that was a good idea.
summary: To combat disinformation, Brazil gave one judge broad power to police the internet. Now, after he blocked X, some are wondering whether that was a good idea.

title: As Ukraine Mourns a Pilot’s Death, Jet’s Crash Is Still a Mystery

summary: In a reversal, two senior U.S. military officials say the cause of the F-16’s crash was probably not friendly fire.

title: Norway’s Princess Martha Louise Weds Self-Proclaimed Shaman Durek Verrett
content: The nuptials of Princess Martha Louise and Durek Verrett attracted huge public interest and a streaming deal for a couple trying to reclaim their narrative after years of bad press.
summary: The nuptials of Princess Martha Louise and Durek Verrett attracted huge public interest and a streaming deal for a couple trying to reclaim their narrative after years of bad press.

title: As Israel Keeps Fighting in West Bank, Residents in One Battle Zone Reel From the Damage
content: In the Nur Shams area near Tulkarm, Israeli bulldozers have chewed up large chunks of the roads, and many homes have been left without running water and internet. One family mourned the death of a relative they said was killed in the raid.
summary: In the Nur Shams area near Tulkarm, Israeli bulldozers have chewed up large chunks of the roads, and many homes have been left without running water and internet. One family mourned the death of a relative they said was killed in the raid.

title: A Playlist to Remember
content: Songs can help demarcate this chapter of your life: It’s a way to mark time, to keep one period of time from bleeding indistinctly into the next.
summary: Songs can help demarcate this chapter of your life: It’s a way to mark time, to keep one period of time from bleeding indistinctly into the next.

title: Will Alberta Replace the Mounties With Its Own Provincial Police Force?
content: Danielle Smith, the premier, told party supporters that the government would expand the role of its sheriffs.
summary: Danielle Smith, the premier, told party supporters that the government would expand the role of its sheriffs.

title: Gaza, Lebanon, West Bank: Why Is Israel Fighting So Many Wars?
content: As well as its conflict with Hamas, Israel is battling along its border with Lebanon, waging a counterinsurgency in the occupied West Bank and exchanging sporadic fire with Iran and its regional proxies.
summary: As well as its conflict with Hamas, Israel is battling along its border with Lebanon, waging a counterinsurgency in the occupied West Bank and exchanging sporadic fire with Iran and its regional proxies.

title: Russia’s Youngest Conscripts Unexpectedly See Combat Against Ukraine’s Invasion
content: The long-sacrosanct practice of keeping young Russian army conscripts off the front lines is eroding as the lack of troops in Russia’s Kursk region indicates a manpower shortage.
summary: The long-sacrosanct practice of keeping young Russian army conscripts off the front lines is eroding as the lack of troops in Russia’s Kursk region indicates a manpower shortage.

title: Hurling, a Centuries-Old Irish Sport, Turns to New Materials
content: For centuries, the sport’s wooden sticks have been made from Ireland’s ash trees. But with a disease destroying forests, the ancient game is turning to different materials.
summary: For centuries, the sport’s wooden sticks have been made from Ireland’s ash trees. But with a disease destroying forests, the ancient game is turning to different materials.

title: Something’s Poisoning America’s Land. Farmers Fear ‘Forever’ Chemicals.
content: Fertilizer made from city sewage has been spread on millions of acres of farmland for decades. Scientists say it can contain high levels of the toxic substance.
summary: Fertilizer made from city sewage has been spread on millions of acres of farmland for decades. Scientists say it can contain high levels of the toxic substance.

title: Gaza Polio Crisis: What We Know
content: Israel and Hamas have agreed to brief pauses in fighting so that humanitarian workers can begin an inoculation campaign.
summary: Israel and Hamas have agreed to brief pauses in fighting so that humanitarian workers can begin an inoculation campaign.

title: The Angry East
content: As east Germans vote, a region in decline is searching for answers on the political extremes.

title: The Debate in Singapore About the New Statue of Raffles

summary: The tribute to Sir Thomas Stamford Raffles, who is considered the founder of Singapore, has raised questions about how the wealthy city-state perceives its history.

content: The Russian president will travel to Mongolia, a member of the International Criminal Court, which issued a warrant for his arrest in 2023.
summary: The Russian president will travel to Mongolia, a member of the International Criminal Court, which issued a warrant for his arrest in 2023.

content: The social network began to go dark in the nation of 200 million, the result of an escalating fight between Elon Musk and a Brazilian judge over what can be said online.
summary: The social network began to go dark in the nation of 200 million, the result of an escalating fight between Elon Musk and a Brazilian judge over what can be said online.

title: Gaza Faces Polio Threat After 11 Months of War
content: Starting Sunday, the Israeli military and Hamas will observe brief, staggered pauses in fighting to allow 640,000 Gazan children to be vaccinated, U.N. officials said.
summary: Starting Sunday, the Israeli military and Hamas will observe brief, staggered pauses in fighting to allow 640,000 Gazan children to be vaccinated, U.N. officials said.

title: Maduro Appears to Send Two Foreign Members of Ukraine’s Military to Face Trial in Russia
content: Two Colombian soldiers who had fought for Ukraine are now under arrest in Moscow. They wound up there after stopping over in Venezuela, which apparently extradited them.
summary: Two Colombian soldiers who had fought for Ukraine are now under arrest in Moscow. They wound up there after stopping over in Venezuela, which apparently extradited them.

title: Why Oil Prices Remain Subdued
content: Despite war in the Middle East and political turmoil in Libya, investors are focusing on what look like ample global supplies.
summary: Despite war in the Middle East and political turmoil in Libya, investors are focusing on what look like ample global supplies.

title: Zelensky Dismisses the Head of the Air Force Days After F-16 Crash
content: The Ukrainian president gave no reason, but there are indications that friendly fire may have brought down the jet, a Western official said.
summary: The Ukrainian president gave no reason, but there are indications that friendly fire may have brought down the jet, a Western official said.

content: The sales of intelligence agency data raised awkward questions as the nation is expanding military information sharing with the United States.
summary: The sales of intelligence agency data raised awkward questions as the nation is expanding military information sharing with the United States.

title: In South Indian Cinema, a #MeToo Reckoning Comes Roaring Back
content: A report withheld since 2019 has finally been released, providing damning evidence of sexual misconduct and gender discrimination in Malayalam cinema.
summary: A report withheld since 2019 has finally been released, providing damning evidence of sexual misconduct and gender discrimination in Malayalam cinema.

title: Inmate Revolts Highlight Failings and Miseries of Russian Prisons
content: Staff shortages, beatings, corruption and harsh treatment of Muslim prisoners have all led to unrest among inmates, with recent uprisings turning deadly.
summary: Staff shortages, beatings, corruption and harsh treatment of Muslim prisoners have all led to unrest among inmates, with recent uprisings turning deadly.

title: How Mexico’s Judicial Overhaul Compares to Other Countries
content: President Andrés Manuel López Obrador’s plan for transforming the judiciary goes much further than other countries that allow some judges to be elected.
summary: President Andrés Manuel López Obrador’s plan for transforming the judiciary goes much further than other countries that allow some judges to be elected.

title: Paris Is Utopia for Paralympians Until They Leave the Athletes’ Village
content: The city built highly accessible accommodations for competitors in the 2024 Paralympic Games. But the rest of Paris remains difficult to navigate.
summary: The city built highly accessible accommodations for competitors in the 2024 Paralympic Games. But the rest of Paris remains difficult to navigate.
